## 266. CARTILAGE
### Definition
a resilient and smooth elastic tissue, a rubber-like padding that covers and protects the ends of long bones at the joints. (Wiki) For the purposes of lexical elicitation, a relatively soft part of a bone that is difficult to chew; often occurs in meat.

### Contexts
It is difficult to chew a cartilage. 2. A cartilage is a soft bone.
